fAnthDisturb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fAnthDisturb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Anthropogenic flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. That is, emissions influenced, caused, or created by human activity. Anthropogenic emission of carbon dioxide includes fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change, except forest regrowth.
fAnthDisturb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation, Litter or Soil Pools into the Atmosphere Due to any Human Activity [kgC m-2 s-1]

fBNF_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fBNF_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: The fixation (uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere) of nitrogen due to biological processes.

fCLandToOcean_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fCLandToOcean_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: leached carbon etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.
fCLandToOcean_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Lateral Transfer of Carbon out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean

fDeforestToAtmos_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fDeforestToAtmos_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
fDeforestToAtmos_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Atmosphere as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]

fDeforestToProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fDeforestToProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
fDeforestToProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change

fFireAll_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fFireAll_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: From all sources,  Including natural, anthropogenic and Land-use change. Only total fire emissions can be compared to observations.
fFireAll_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Including All Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]

fFireNat_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fFireNat_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Natural Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

fFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux) from natural fires + human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the DGVM, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc, defined below (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).
fFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Excluding Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]

fHarvestToAtmos_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fHarvestToAtmos_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: any harvested carbon that is assumed to decompose immediately into the atmosphere is reported here
fHarvestToAtmos_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Harvested Biomass That Goes Straight into Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

fHarvestToGeologicStorage_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fHarvestToGeologicStorage_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Flux of carbon harvested from biomass that goes into geologic storage for the purposes of intentional carbon dioxide removal, via efforts such as bioenergy with carbon capture and storage (BECCS) or biomass removal and storage (BiCRS). The definition of geologic storage here is that the resulting carbon be  stored for a period of time that is long relative to that of the simulation.
fHarvestToGeologicStorage_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Geological Storage

fHarvestToProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fHarvestToProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: be it food or wood harvest, any carbon that is subsequently stored is reported here
fHarvestToProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool

fLitterFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fLitterFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources
fLitterFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass Flux from Litter, CWD or any non-Living Pool into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

fLitterSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fLitterSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into soil from litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).
fLitterSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil

fLuc_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fLuc_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Land Use Change
fLuc_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]

fLulccAtmLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: This annual mean flux refers to the transfer of carbon directly to the atmosphere due to any land-use or land-cover change activities.  Include carbon transferred due to deforestation or agricultural directly into atmosphere, and  emissions form anthropogenic pools into atmosphere
fLulccAtmLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Carbon Transferred Directly to Atmosphere Due to any Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Activities [kgC m-2 s-1]

fN2O_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fN2O_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Surface upward flux of nitrous oxide (N2O) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.

fNAnthDisturb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNAnthDisturb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: will require some careful definition to make sure we capture everything - any human activity that releases nitrogen from land  instead of into product pool goes here. E.g. Deforestation fire, harvest assumed to decompose straight away, grazing...
fNAnthDisturb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Nitrogen Mass Flux out of Land Due to any Human Activity

fNLandToOcean_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNLandToOcean_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: leached nitrogen etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.
fNLandToOcean_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Lateral Transfer of Nitrogen out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean

fNLitterSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNLitterSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.
fNLitterSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Litter to Soil

fNOx_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNOx_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The phrase "expressed\_as" is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. "Nox" means a combination of two radical species containing nitrogen and oxygen NO+NO2. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

fNProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
fNProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Deforested or Harvested Biomass as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use or Change

fNVegLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNVegLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass.
fNVegLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter

fNVegSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNVegSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: In some models part of nitrogen (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.
fNVegSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil

fNdep_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNdep_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Dry and Wet Deposition of Reactive Nitrogen onto Land

fNfert_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNfert_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Total Nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure). Relative to total land area of a grid cell, not relative to agricultural area
fNfert_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Nitrogen Added for Cropland Fertilisation (Artificial and Manure)

fNgasFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNgasFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to fire
fNgasFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from Fire

fNgasNonFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNgasNonFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to all processes other than fire
fNgasNonFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from All Processes Except Fire

fNgas_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNgas_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.
fNgas_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)

fNleach_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNleach_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due\_to\_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Leaching" means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, "runoff" refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.
fNleach_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Nitrogen Loss to Leaching or Runoff (Sum of Ammonium, Nitrite and Nitrate)

fNloss_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNloss_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Not all models split losses into gaseous and leaching
fNloss_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Nitrogen Lost (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and Leaching)

fNnetmin_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNnetmin_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Loss of soil nitrogen through remineralization and immobilisation. Remineralization is the degradation of organic matter into inorganic forms of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus and other micronutrients, which consumes oxygen and releases energy. Immobilisation of nitrogen refers to retention of nitrogen by micro-organisms under certain conditions, making it unavailable for plants.
fNnetmin_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Net Nitrogen Release from Soil and Litter as the Outcome of Nitrogen Immobilisation and Gross Mineralisation

fNup_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fNup_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: The uptake of nitrogen by fixation: nitrogen fixation means the uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere.
fNup_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Plant Nitrogen Uptake (Sum of Ammonium and Nitrate) Irrespective of the Source of Nitrogen

fProductDecomp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fProductDecomp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.
fProductDecomp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Decomposition out of Product Pools to CO2 in Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

fVegFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fVegFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources
fVegFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

fVegLitterMortality_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fVegLitterMortality_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
fVegLitterMortality_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Mortality

fVegLitterSenescence_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fVegLitterSenescence_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
fVegLitterSenescence_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence

fVegLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fVegLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass\_flux\_of\_carbon\_into\_litter\_from\_vegetation\_due\_to\_mortality and mass\_flux\_of\_carbon\_into\_litter\_from\_vegetation\_due\_to\_senescence is mass\_flux\_of\_carbon\_into\_litter\_from\_vegetation.
fVegLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter

fVegSoilMortality_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fVegSoilMortality_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
fVegSoilMortality_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Mortality

fVegSoilSenescence_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fVegSoilSenescence_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
fVegSoilSenescence_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence

fVegSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
fVegSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: In some models part of carbon (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.
fVegSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil

fco2antt_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.
fco2antt_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fco2antt_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.
fco2antt_tpt-u-hxys-u.ui-label: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fco2fos_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)
fco2fos_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fco2fos_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)
fco2fos_tpt-u-hxys-u.ui-label: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fco2nat_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L\_mon and O\_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., "net ecosystem biospheric productivity", for land, and "air to sea CO2 flux", for ocean.)
fco2nat_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]

fco2nat_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L\_mon and O\_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., "net ecosystem biospheric productivity", for land, and "air to sea CO2 flux", for ocean.)
fco2nat_tpt-u-hxys-u.ui-label: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]

fg13co2_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
fg13co2_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Gas exchange flux of abiotic 13CO2 (positive into ocean)
fg13co2_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-13 as 13CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fg14co2_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
fg14co2_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Gas exchange flux of carbon-14 as CO2 (positive into ocean)
fg14co2_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fg14co2abio_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
fg14co2abio_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Gas exchange flux of abiotic 14CO2 (positive into ocean)
fg14co2abio_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as Abiotic 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fgco2_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
fgco2_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Gas exchange flux of CO2 (positive into ocean)
fgco2_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon as CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

fgdms_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
fgdms_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Gas exchange flux of DMS (positive into atmosphere)

ficeberg_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
ficeberg_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: computed as the iceberg melt water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
ficeberg_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs

ficeberg_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
ficeberg_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: computed as the iceberg melt water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
ficeberg_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs

flandice_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
flandice_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to land ice (runoff water from surface and base of land ice or melt from base of ice shelf or vertical ice front) into the ocean divided by the area ocean portion of the grid cell
flandice_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Water Flux into Sea Water from Land Ice

fracInLut_tsum-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land over all_area_types time: sum
fracInLut_tsum-u-hxy-lnd.description: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as a percentage of atmospheric grid cell
fracInLut_tsum-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Annual Gross Percentage That Was Transferred into This Tile from Other Land-Use Tiles

fracLut_tpt-u-hxy-u.description: End of year values (not annual mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac\_lnd = 0.5, frac\_ocn = 0.5, frac\_crop\_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac\_lut(crop) = 0.5\*0.2 = 0.1)
fracLut_tpt-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile

fracOutLut_tsum-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land over all_area_types time: sum
fracOutLut_tsum-u-hxy-lnd.description: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as percentage of atmospheric grid cell
fracOutLut_tsum-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Annual Gross Percentage of Land-Use Tile That Was Transferred into Other Land-Use Tiles

frfe_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
frfe_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

fric_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
fric_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Downward Inorganic Carbon Flux at Ocean Bottom

friver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
friver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
friver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers

frn_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
frn_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase. 'Denitrification' is the conversion of nitrate into gaseous compounds such as nitric oxide, nitrous oxide and molecular nitrogen which are then emitted to the atmosphere.  'Sedimentation' is the sinking of particulate matter to the floor of a body of water. "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.
frn_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Nitrogen Loss to Sediments and Through Denitrification

froc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
froc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Downward Organic Carbon Flux at Ocean Bottom

fsfe_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
fsfe_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Iron supply through deposition flux onto sea surface, runoff, coasts, sediments, etc
fsfe_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Downward Net Flux of Iron

fsn_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
fsn_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Flux of nitrogen into the ocean due to deposition (sum of dry and wet deposition), fixation (the production of ammonia from nitrogen gas by diazotrophs) and runoff (liquid water which drains from land).
fsn_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Downward Net Flux of Nitrogen

gppLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.
gppLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Gross Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

gppVgt_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.
gppVgt_tavg-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Gross Primary Production on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

gpp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
gpp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.
gpp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

gpp_tavg-u-hxy-ng.description: Total GPP of grass in the grid cell
gpp_tavg-u-hxy-ng.ui-label: Gross Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

gpp_tavg-u-hxy-shb.description: Total GPP of shrubs in the grid cell
gpp_tavg-u-hxy-shb.ui-label: Gross Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

gpp_tavg-u-hxy-tree.description: Total GPP of trees in the grid cell
gpp_tavg-u-hxy-tree.ui-label: Gross Primary Production on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

gppc13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
gppc13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: The rate of synthesis of carbon-13 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.
gppc13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon-13 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

gppc14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
gppc14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: The rate of synthesis of carbon-14 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.
gppc14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon-14 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

grassFracC3_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 natural grass.

grassFracC4_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 natural grass.

grassFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.

graz_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
graz_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Total grazing of phytoplankton by zooplankton defined as tendency of moles of carbon per cubic metre.
graz_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Total Grazing of Phytoplankton by Zooplankton

h2_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This is the mole fraction of molecular hydrogen (H2) in air

h2loss_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This is the loss rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) from the atmosphere due to chemical destruction

h2prod_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This is the production of molecular hydrogen (H2) in the atmosphere due to chemical production

hcfc22_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This is the mole fraction of HCFC22 in air

hcfc22_tavg-u-hm-u.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ area: time: mean (with all samples weighted by the number of moles of air in the sample)
hcfc22_tavg-u-hm-u.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for HCFC22 is CHClF2.  The IUPAC name for HCFC22 is chloro-difluoro-methane.
hcfc22_tavg-u-hm-u.ui-label: Global Mean Mole Fraction of HCFC22

hcho_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

hcl_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydrogen chloride is HCl.

hcl_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydrogen chloride is HCl.

hfacrossline_tavg-u-ht-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea depth: sum where sea time: mean
hfacrossline_tavg-u-ht-sea.description: Depth-integrated total heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes across different lines on the Earth's surface (based on appendix J and table J1 of Griffies et al., 2016). Formally, this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the heat transport. Positive and negative numbers refer to total northward/eastward and southward/westward transports, respectively. The transport should be evaluated for the full depth of the ocean, except for the Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is averaged from the surface to 350m. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

hfbasin_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ longitude: sum where sea (along a zig-zag grid path spanning a basin) where sea time: mean
hfbasin_tavg-u-hys-sea.description: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.   Use Celsius for temperature scale.

hfbasinpadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ longitude: sum where sea (along a zig-zag grid path spanning a basin) where sea time: mean
hfbasinpadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.description: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized eddy-induced advective transport due to any subgrid advective process. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.
hfbasinpadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.ui-label: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection

hfbasinpmadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ longitude: sum where sea (along a zig-zag grid path spanning a basin) where sea time: mean
hfbasinpmadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.description: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.
hfbasinpmadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.ui-label: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection

hfbasinpmdiff_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ longitude: sum where sea (along a zig-zag grid path spanning a basin) where sea time: mean
hfbasinpmdiff_tavg-u-hys-sea.description: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced diffusive transport (i.e., neutral diffusion). Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.
hfbasinpmdiff_tavg-u-hys-sea.ui-label: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion

hfbasinpsmadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ longitude: sum where sea (along a zig-zag grid path spanning a basin) where sea time: mean
hfbasinpsmadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.description: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.
hfbasinpsmadv_tavg-u-hys-sea.ui-label: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection

hfc125_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This is the mole fraction of HFC125 in air

hfc134a_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This is the mole fraction of HFC134a in air

hfds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
hfds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any 'flux adjustment').
hfds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface

hfdsl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean

hfdsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
hfdsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: the net downward heat flux from the atmosphere into the snow that lies on land divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing for snow-free land regions or where the land fraction is 0.
hfdsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Downward Heat Flux into Snow Where Land over Land

hfdsnb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
hfdsnb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Downward heat flux at snow botton
hfdsnb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Downward Heat Flux at Snow Base

hfevapds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ time: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
hfevapds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.description: This is defined as "where ice\_free\_sea over sea"
hfevapds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.ui-label: Temperature Flux Due to Evaporation Expressed as Heat Flux out of Sea Water

hfgeou_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
hfgeou_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Upward geothermal heat flux per unit area on the sea floor
hfgeou_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor

hfgeou_ti-u-hxy-sea.description: Upward geothermal heat flux per unit area on the sea floor
hfgeou_ti-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor

hfgeoubed_tavg-u-hxy-gis.description: Geothermal Heat Flux Beneath Land Ice
hfgeoubed_tavg-u-hxy-gis.ui-label: Geothermal Heat Flux Beneath Land Ice

hfgeoubed_ti-u-hxy-gis.description: Geothermal Heat Flux Beneath Land Ice
hfgeoubed_ti-u-hxy-gis.ui-label: Geothermal Heat Flux Beneath Land Ice

hfibthermds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
hfibthermds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics
hfibthermds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics

hfibthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
hfibthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics
hfibthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics

hflsLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
hflsLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Latent Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile

hfls_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
hfls_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Ice Sheet Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux

hfls_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

hfrainds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ time: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
hfrainds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.description: This is defined as "where ice\_free\_sea over sea"; i.e., the total flux (considered here) entering the ice-free portion of the grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  All such heat fluxes are computed based on Celsius scale.
hfrainds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.ui-label: Temperature Flux Due to Rainfall Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water

hfrunoffds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
hfrunoffds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.
hfrunoffds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water

hfrunoffds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
hfrunoffds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.
hfrunoffds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water

hfsnthermds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
hfsnthermds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "Snow thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.
hfsnthermds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Snow Thermodynamics

hfsnthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
hfsnthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "Snow thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.
hfsnthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Snow Thermodynamics

hfssLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: Upward sensible heat flux on land use tiles. The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.
hfssLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Sensible Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile

hfss_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

hfss_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Hourly surface upward sensible heat flux

hfss_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

hfx_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
hfx_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale

hfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea depth: sum where sea (over entire ocean column) time: mean
hfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Ocean heat x transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale. Report on native horizontal grid.
hfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Vertically Integrated Ocean Heat X Transport

hfy_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
hfy_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

hfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea depth: sum where sea (over entire ocean column) time: mean
hfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Ocean heat y transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale. Report on native horizontal grid.
hfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Vertically Integrated Ocean Heat Y Transport

hno3_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

hno3_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

ho2_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydroperoxyl radical is HO2.

htovgyre_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ longitude: sum where sea (along a zig-zag grid path spanning a basin)  time: mean
htovgyre_tavg-u-hys-sea.description: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
htovgyre_tavg-u-hys-sea.ui-label: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Gyre

htovovrt_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ longitude: sum where sea (along a zig-zag grid path spanning a basin)  time: mean
htovovrt_tavg-u-hys-sea.description: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
htovovrt_tavg-u-hys-sea.ui-label: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Overturning

hur_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hur_tavg-p19-hxy-air.description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hur_tavg-p19-hxy-u.description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hur_tpt-500hPa-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: point
hur_tpt-500hPa-hxy-air.description: Relative humidity at 500 hPa, 6 hourly instantaneous

hur_tpt-850hPa-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: point

hur_tpt-al-hxys-u.description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hurs_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Relative humidity at 2m above the surface

hurs_tmax-h2m-hxy-u.description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hurs_tmin-h2m-hxy-crp.description: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hurs_tpt-h2m-hxy-u.description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hurs_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hus_tavg-p19-hxy-u.description: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

hus_tpt-al-hxys-u.description: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

hus_tpt-p6-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: point
hus_tpt-p6-hxy-air.description: Specific humidity on 6 pressure levels in the lower troposphere

hus_tpt-p7h-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: point

iareafl_tavg-u-hm-fis.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ sum where floating_ice_shelf (mask=sftflf) time: mean

irrDem_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: the total amount of irrigation water demand

irrGw_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: the amount of water withdrawal for irrigation from ground water, including deep soil water, confined and unconfined aquifer, etc

irrLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: Mass flux of water due to irrigation.
irrLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Irrigation Flux Including any Irrigation for Crops, Trees, Pasture, or Urban Lawns

irrLut_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: the total amount of water withdrawal from multiple sources

irrSurf_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: the amount of water withdrawal for irrigation from surface water, including rivers, lakes, reservoirs, etc.)
irrSurf_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: irrigation water withdrawal from surface water

isop_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mole fraction of isoprene in air.

jpdftaureicemodis_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint  distribution, ice
jpdftaureicemodis_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice

jpdftaureliqmodis_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size joint distribution, liquid
jpdftaureliqmodis_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid

laiLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.
laiLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Leaf Area Index on Land-Use Tile

laiVgt_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.
laiVgt_tavg-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Leaf Area Index on Vegetation type

lai_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
lai_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

landCoverFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their  PFT definitions.   This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc.   Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid-cell that is land.
landCoverFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Percentage of Area by Vegetation or Land-Cover Category

lat_ti-u-hxys-u.description: Latitude is positive northward; its units of degree\_north (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid\_latitude should be used instead of latitude. Grid latitude is positive in the grid-northward direction, but its units should be plain degree.

libmassbf_tavg-u-hxy-fis.description: quantity averaged over floating ice shelf
libmassbf_tavg-u-hxy-fis.ui-label: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Floating Ice Shelf

libmassbf_tavg-u-hxy-gis.description: quantity averaged over grounded ice sheet
libmassbf_tavg-u-hxy-gis.ui-label: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Grounded Ice Sheet

licalvf_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: Loss of ice mass resulting from iceberg calving. Computed as the rate of mass loss by the ice shelf (in kg s-1) divided by the horizontal area of the ice sheet (m2) in the grid box.

lifmassbf_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: Total mass balance at the ice front (or vertical margin). It includes both iceberg calving and melt on vertical ice front
lifmassbf_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Land Ice Vertical Front Mass Balance Flux

lim_tavg-u-hm-is.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ sum where ice_sheet time: mean

limfecalc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limfecalc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: "Calcareous phytoplankton" are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfediat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limfediat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfediaz_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limfediaz_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfemisc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limfemisc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Miscellaneous phytoplankton" are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfepico_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limfepico_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limirrcalc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limirrcalc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Growth limitation of calcareous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrdiat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limirrdiat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Growth limitation of diatoms due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrdiaz_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limirrdiaz_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Growth limitation of diazotrophs due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrmisc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limirrmisc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Growth limitation of miscellaneous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrpico_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limirrpico_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Growth limitation of picophytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limncalc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limncalc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: "Calcareous phytoplankton" are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limndiat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limndiat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limndiaz_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limndiaz_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limnmisc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limnmisc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Miscellaneous phytoplankton" are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limnpico_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
limnpico_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limnsw_tavg-u-hm-is.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ sum where ice_sheet time: mean
limnsw_tavg-u-hm-is.ui-label: Ice Sheet Mass That Does not Displace Sea Water

litempbot_tavg-u-hxy-fis.description: quantity averaged over floating land ice
litempbot_tavg-u-hxy-fis.ui-label: Basal Temperature of Floating Ice Shelf

litempbot_tavg-u-hxy-gis.description: quantity averaged over grounded land ice
litempbot_tavg-u-hxy-gis.ui-label: Basal Temperature of Grounded Ice Sheet

litemptop_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice sheet only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
litemptop_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model

lithk_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: This is needed in case ice sheet thickness changes in time

lithk_ti-u-hxy-is.description: The thickness of the ice sheet

lithk_ti-u-hxy-u.description: This variable identifies the thickness of a prescribed ice sheet. This information is relevant to better understand how different models treat ice. For models where an ice sheet is just orography + an ice sheet mask, the value should be set to zero. For models that explicitly resolve an ice sheet thickness, the thickness of the ice sheet should be provided.

loadbc_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of black carbon aerosol particles per unit area.

loaddust_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of dust aerosol particles per unit area.

loadnh4_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of ammonium aerosol particles per unit area.

loadno3_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of nitrate aerosol particles per unit area.

loadoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: atmosphere dry organic content: This is the vertically integrated sum of atmosphere\_primary\_organic\_content and atmosphere\_secondary\_organic\_content (see next two table entries).
loadoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Load of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter

loadpoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of primary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.
loadpoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Load of Dry Aerosol Primary Organic Matter

loadso4_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of sulfate aerosol particles per unit area.

loadsoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of secondary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.
loadsoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Load of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter

loadss_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of sea salt aerosol particles per unit area.

lon_ti-u-hxys-u.description: Longitude is positive eastward; its units of degree\_east (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid\_longitude should be used instead of longitude. Grid longitude is positive in the grid-eastward direction, but its units should be plain degree.

lossco_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Carbon Monoxide

lossn2o_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Nitrous Oxide

lwp_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total mass of liquid water in cloud per unit area.

lwsnl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
lwsnl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: where land over land: this is computed as the total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the snow layer of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.
lwsnl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer

masscello_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
masscello_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times grid celll volume.

masscello_ti-ol-hxy-sea.description: Tracer grid-cell mass per unit area used for computing tracer budgets. For Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness, masscello = rhozero\*thickcello, where thickcello is static cell thickness and rhozero is constant Boussinesq reference density. More generally, masscello is time dependent and reported as part of Omon.

masso_tavg-u-hm-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ sum where sea time: mean
masso_tavg-u-hm-sea.description: Total mass of liquid sea water. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

mc_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

mc_tpt-alh-hxys-u.description: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the updrafts).

mcd_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

mcu_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

meanage_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.

meanage_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.

mfo_tavg-u-ht-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ sum where sea time: mean
mfo_tavg-u-ht-sea.description: Transport across\_line means that which crosses a particular line on the Earth's surface (based on appendix J and table J1 of Griffies et al, 2016 (<https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-3231-2016>). Formally this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the transport. The transport should be evaluated for the full depth of the ocean, except for the Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is averaged from the surface to 350m.

mlotst_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
mlotst_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface. Defined by Sigma T of 0.03 kg m-3 wrt to model level closest to 10 m depth.
mlotst_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

mlotstmax_tmax-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: maximum
mlotstmax_tmax-u-hxy-sea.description: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface. Defined by Sigma T of 0.03 kg m-3 wrt to model level closest to 10 m depth.
mlotstmax_tmax-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

mlotstmin_tmin-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: minimum
mlotstmin_tmin-u-hxy-sea.description: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface. Defined by Sigma T of 0.03 kg m-3 wrt to model level closest to 10 m depth.
mlotstmin_tmin-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Minimum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

mlotstsq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
mlotstsq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: The phrase "square\_of\_X" means X\*X. The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by "temperature", "sigma", "sigma\_theta", "sigma\_t" or vertical diffusivity is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea\_water\_sigma\_t\_difference can be used to specify the sigma\_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. Sigma-t of sea water is the density of water at atmospheric pressure (i.e. the surface) having the same temperature and salinity, minus 1000 kg m-3. "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer.
mlotstsq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Square of Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

mmraerh2o_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mass fraction is used in the construction mass\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). "Aerosol" means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. "Ambient\_aerosol" means that the aerosol is measured or modelled at the ambient state of pressure, temperature and relative humidity that exists in its immediate environment. "Ambient aerosol particles" are aerosol particles that have taken up ambient water through hygroscopic growth. The extent of hygroscopic growth depends on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles.

mmraerh2o_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Daily mean Aerosol water mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer
mmraerh2o_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.ui-label: Daily mean surface Aerosol water mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

mmraerh2o_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface aerosol water Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
mmraerh2o_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.ui-label: Instantaneous surface aerosol water mass mixing ratio at CF sites

mmrbc_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Dry mass fraction of black carbon aerosol particles in air.

mmrbc_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Daily mean elemental carbon mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

mmrbc_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface elemental carbon Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

mmrdust_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Dry mass fraction of dust aerosol particles in air.

mmrdust_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Daily mean dust aerosol mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

mmrdust_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface Dust Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
mmrdust_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.ui-label: Instantaneous surface Dust Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites

mmrnh4_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Dry mass fraction of ammonium aerosol particles in air.

mmrnh4_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Daily mean NH4 mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

mmrnh4_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface NH4 Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
mmrnh4_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.ui-label: Instantaneous surface NH4 aerosol mass mixing ratio at CF sites

mmrno3_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Dry mass fraction of nitrate aerosol particles in air.

mmrno3_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Daily mean NO3 aerosol mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

mmrno3_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface NO3 Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
mmrno3_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.ui-label: Instantaneous surface NO3 aerosol mass mixing ratio at CF sites

mmroa_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4\*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available.
mmroa_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Total Organic Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio

mmroa_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Daily mean total organic aerosol mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

mmroa_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface organic aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours.
mmroa_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.ui-label: Instantaneous surface total organic aerosol mass mixing ratio at CF sites

mmrpm1_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mass fraction atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 1 micrometers

mmrpm2p5_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mass fraction atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 2.5 micrometers

mmrso4_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Dry mass of sulfate (SO4) in aerosol particles as a fraction of air mass.

mmrso4_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Daily mean sulfate aerosol mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

mmrso4_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.description: This variable is for instantaneous surface mass mixing ratio of sulfate aerosol at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
mmrso4_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.ui-label: Instantaneous Aerosol Sulfate Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites

mmrsoa_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mass fraction in the atmosphere of secondary organic aerosols (particulate organic matter formed within the atmosphere from gaseous precursors; dry mass).
mmrsoa_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Secondary Organic Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio

mmrsoa_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Daily mean secondary organic aerosol mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

mmrss_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mass fraction in the atmosphere of sea salt aerosol (dry mass).

mmrss_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Daily mean Sea Salt mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

mmrss_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.description: This variable represents instantaneous surface sea salt aerosol mass mixing ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
mmrss_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.ui-label: Sea salt Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites

mpw_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
mpw_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

mpwswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
mpwswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) of swell waves only (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

mpwwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
mpwwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) of wind-sea waves only (i.e., local wind waves). In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

mrfso_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
mrfso_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: the mass (summed over all all layers) of frozen water.

mrroLi_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: Runoff flux over land ice is the difference between any available liquid water in the snowpack less any refreezing. Computed as the sum of rainfall and melt of snow or ice less any refreezing or water retained in the snowpack

mrro_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

mrro_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
mrro_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

mrrob_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean

mrros_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
mrros_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: the total surface runoff leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

mrsfl_tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
mrsfl_tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in ice phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"
mrsfl_tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Frozen Water Content of Soil Layer

mrsll_tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
mrsll_tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"
mrsll_tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Liquid Water Content of Soil Layer

mrso_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
mrso_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

mrsofc_ti-u-hxy-lnd.description: reported "where land": divide the total water holding capacity of all the soil in the grid cell by the land area in the grid cell;  reported as "missing" where the land fraction is 0.

n2o_tavg-p19-hxy-air.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

nLand_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
nLand_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.
nLand_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Nitrogen in All Terrestrial Nitrogen Pools

nLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
nLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.

nLitterCwd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
nLitterCwd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Wood debris" means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood\_debris\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen, surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.
nLitterCwd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Nitrogen Mass in Coarse Woody Debris

nLitterSubSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
nLitterSubSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Subsurface litter" means the part of the litter mixed within the soil below the surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood\_debris\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen, surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.
nLitterSubSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Nitrogen Mass in Below-Ground Litter (non CWD)

nLitterSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
nLitterSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Surface litter" means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood\_debris\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen, surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.
nLitterSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Nitrogen Mass in Above-Ground Litter (non CWD)

nLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
nLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.
