nbp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
nbp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes  from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux  is into the land.
nbp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Biospheric Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

ncfc22_tavg-u-hm-u.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ area: time: mean (with all samples weighted by the number of moles of air in the sample)
ncfc22_tavg-u-hm-u.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for HCFC22 is CHClF2.  The IUPAC name for HCFC22 is chloro-difluoro-methane.
ncfc22_tavg-u-hm-u.ui-label: Global Mean Mole Fraction of HCFC22

necbLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: Computed as npp minus heterotrophic respiration minus fire minus C leaching minus harvesting/clearing. Positive rate is into the land, negative rate is from the land.  Do not include fluxes from anthropogenic product pools to atmosphere
necbLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Land-Use Tile [kgC m-2 s-1]

nep_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
nep_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Ecosystem Productivity on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

netAtmosLandC13Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
netAtmosLandC13Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Flux of carbon 31as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral\_carbon\_transfer\_over\_land term, see below, will be zero data).-
netAtmosLandC13Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Net Mass Flux of 13C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]

netAtmosLandC14Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
netAtmosLandC14Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Flux of carbon-14 as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral\_carbon\_transfer\_over\_land term, see below, will be zero data).
netAtmosLandC14Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Net Mass Flux of 14C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]

netAtmosLandCO2Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
netAtmosLandCO2Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral\_carbon\_transfer\_over\_land term, see below, will be zero data).
netAtmosLandCO2Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Net Flux of CO2 Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]

noaahi2m_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description:
mean 2m daily NOAA heat index.
The perceived air temperature when relative humidity is taken into consideration (which makes it feel hotter than the actual air temperature).
The heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K.
NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523(T) + 10.14333127(R) - 0.22475541(T)(R) - 6.83783e-3 sqr(T) - 5.481717e-2 sqr(R) + 1.22874e-3 sqr(T) (R) + 8.5282e-4 (T) sqr(R) - 1.99e-6 sqr(T) sqr(R)
where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%)

noaahi2m_tmax-h2m-hxy-u.description:
max 2m daily NOAA heat index 
The perceived air temperature when relative humidity is taken into consideration (which makes it feel hotter than the actual air temperature).
The heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K.
NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523(T) + 10.14333127(R) - 0.22475541(T)(R) - 6.83783e-3 sqr(T) - 5.481717e-2 sqr(R) + 1.22874e-3 sqr(T) (R) + 8.5282e-4 (T) sqr(R) - 1.99e-6 sqr(T) sqr(R)
where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%)

noy_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model); list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. NOy = N + NO + NO2 + NO3 + HNO3 + 2N2O5 + HNO4 + ClONO2 + BrONO2 Definition: Total reactive nitrogen; usually includes atomic nitrogen (N), nitric oxide (NO), NO2, nitrogen trioxide (NO3), dinitrogen radical (N2O5), nitric acid (HNO3), peroxynitric acid (HNO4), BrONO2, ClONO2 add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields
noy_tavg-p39-hy-air.ui-label: Total Reactive Nitrogen Volume Mixing Ratio

nppLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
nppLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: This is the rate of carbon uptake by leaves due to NPP
nppLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Net Primary Production Allocated to Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

nppLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed\_as" is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.
nppLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Net Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

nppOther_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean

nppRoot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean

o3_tavg-p19-hxy-air.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

o3_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

o3_tclm-p19-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: mean within years time: mean over years
o3_tclm-p19-hxy-air.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

o3_tmax-h2m-hxy-u.description: maximum near-surface ozone  (add cell\_methods attribute "time: maximum")
o3_tmax-h2m-hxy-u.ui-label: Daily Maximum O3 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer

o3_tpt-al-hxy-u.description: This is the mole fraction of ozone in air, sampled on the first day of the month as an instantaneous field.

o3loss_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: ONLY provide the sum of the following reactions: (i) O(1D)+H2O; (ii) O3+HO2; (iii) O3+OH; (iv) O3+alkenes (isoprene, ethene,...)

o3prod_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: ONLY provide the sum of all the HO2/RO2 + NO reactions (as k\*[HO2]\*[NO])

o3ref_tclm-al-hxy-u.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ time: mean (monthly mean fixed annual cycle)
o3ref_tclm-al-hxy-u.description: This is the ozone mole fraction that is used in a diagnostic call to the model's radiation scheme. It is only applicable when an ozone double call is active in the model.
o3ref_tclm-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Fixed Reference Climatology of Mole Fraction of Ozone in Air

o3ref_ti-al-hxy-u.description: This is the ozone mole fraction that is used in a diagnostic call to the model's radiation scheme. It is only applicable when an ozone double call is active in the model.
o3ref_ti-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Fixed Reference Mole Fraction of Ozone in Air

o3ste_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone.
o3ste_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Stratospheric Ozone Tracer Volume Mixing Ratio

obvfsq_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
obvfsq_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: The phrase "square\_of\_X" means X\*X. Frequency is the number of oscillations of a wave per unit time. Brunt-Vaisala frequency is also sometimes called "buoyancy frequency" and is a measure of the vertical stratification of the medium.
obvfsq_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Square of Brunt Vaisala Frequency in Sea Water

ocfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
ocfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Organic Carbon supply to ocean through runoff (separate from gas exchange)
ocfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Flux of Organic Carbon into Ocean Surface by Runoff

ocontempdiff_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
ocontempdiff_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized dianeutral mixing. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
ocontempdiff_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing

ocontempmint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
ocontempmint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Full column sum of density\*cell thickness\*conservative temperature. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.
ocontempmint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Conservative Temperature

ocontemppadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
ocontemppadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized eddy advection (all forms of eddy advection). Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
ocontemppadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection

ocontemppmdiff_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
ocontemppmdiff_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
ocontemppmdiff_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion

ocontemppsmadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
ocontemppsmadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
ocontemppsmadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection

ocontemprmadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
ocontemprmadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from residual mean  (sum of Eulerian mean + parameterized eddy-induced) advection. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
ocontemprmadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection

ocontemptend_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
ocontemptend_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
ocontemptend_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content

od443aer_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is the aerosol optical depth (AOD) from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 443 nm"

od550aer_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: AOD from ambient aerosols (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 550 nm"

od550bb_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: total organic aerosol AOD due to biomass burning (excluding so4, nitrate BB components)
od550bb_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm Due to Biomass Burning

od550bc_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total aerosol AOD due to black carbon aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

od550csaer_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: AOD from the ambient aerosols in clear skies if od550aer is for all-sky (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 550 nm"

od550dust_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total aerosol AOD due to dust aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

od550lt1aer_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: od550 due to particles with wet diameter less than 1 um  ("ambient" means "wetted"). When models do not include explicit size information, it can be assumed that all anthropogenic aerosols and natural secondary aerosols have diameter less than 1 um.
od550lt1aer_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Ambient Fine Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm

od550no3_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total aerosol AOD due to nitrate aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

od550oa_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: total organic aerosol AOD, comprises all organic aerosols, primary + secondary ; natural + anthropogenic including biomasss burning organic aerosol
od550oa_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Total Organic Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm

od550so4_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total aerosol AOD due to sulfate aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

od550soa_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: total organic aerosol AOD due to secondary aerosol formation
od550soa_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Particulate Organic Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm

od550ss_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total aerosol AOD due to sea salt aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

od865aer_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: AOD from the ambient aerosols (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 865 nm"

oh_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

oh_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

opottemppmdiff_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
opottemppmdiff_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion

opottemppsmadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
opottemppsmadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
opottemppsmadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection

opottemprmadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from residual mean (sum of Eulerian mean + parameterized eddy-induced) advection. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
opottemprmadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection

opottemptend_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
opottemptend_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.
opottemptend_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content

orog_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

orog_ti-u-hxy-u.description: height above the geoid; as defined here, "the geoid" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Reported here is the height above the present-day geoid (0.0 over ocean).

osaltdiff_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean

osaltpsmadvect_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection

pan_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

pastureFracC3_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 pasture

pastureFracC4_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 pasture

pastureFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by anthropogenic pasture.

pbo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean

pflw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Liquid Water Content of Permafrost Layer

pfscint_tavg-op4-hxy-sea.description: This is a fundamental aspect of the changes in the hydrological cycle and their impact on the oceans, and due to new numerical schemes and vertical discretizations, it is important to calculate it consistently with the model formulation.
pfscint_tavg-op4-hxy-sea.ui-label: Integral wrt depth of seawater preformed salinity expressed as salt mass content

pfull_tclm-al-hxy-u.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean time: mean within years time: mean over years

ph_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean

phyc_tavg-op20bar-hxy-sea.description: sum of phytoplankton carbon component concentrations. In most (all?) cases this is the sum of phycdiat and phycmisc (i.e., "Diatom Carbon Concentration" and "Non-Diatom Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration"

phydiatos_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
phydiatos_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.description: carbon from the diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone
phydiatos_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Mole Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

phydiaz_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
phydiaz_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.description: Mole Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

phydiaz_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: carbon concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

phydiazos_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
phydiazos_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.description: carbon concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone
phydiazos_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Mole Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

phymisc_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
phymisc_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.description: Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

phymisc_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: carbon concentration from additional phytoplankton component alone
phymisc_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

phynano_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
phynano_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Mole Concentration of Nanophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
phynano_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Mole Concentration of Nanophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

phypico_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
phypico_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.description: carbon concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone
phypico_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

phypico_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
phypico_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: carbon concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone
phypico_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

po4_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
po4_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic phosphorus" means the sum of all inorganic phosphorus in solution (including phosphate, hydrogen phosphate, dihydrogen phosphate, and phosphoric acid).

pod0_tsum-u-hxy-u.description: Accumulated stomatal ozone flux over the threshold of 0 mol m-2 s-1; Computation: Time Integral of (hourly above canopy ozone concentration \* stomatal conductance \* Rc/(Rb+Rc) )

pp_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
pp_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.description: total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton

pp_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
pp_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton

pr17O_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-17 isotope (H2 17O), including solid and liquid phases.
pr17O_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Precipitation Flux of Water Containing Oxygen-17 (H2 17O)

pr18O_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-18 isotope (H2 18O), including solid and liquid phases.
pr18O_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Precipitation Flux of Water Containing Oxygen-18 (H2 18O)

pr2h_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain one atom of the hydrogen-2 isotope (1H 2H O), including solid and liquid phases.
pr2h_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Precipitation Flux of Water Containing Deuterium (1H 2H O)

pr_tavg-u-hxy-crp.description: includes both liquid and solid phases

pr_tmax-u-hxy-u.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

pr_tpt-u-hxy-u.description: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)

pr_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)

prc_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

prc_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

prra_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

prra_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean

prra_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Mass of liquid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area. If the rain is directly put into the ocean, it should not be counted towards sipr. Always positive or zero.

prra_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Rainfall rate at surface: Includes precipitation of all forms of water in the liquid phase

prrsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean

prsn18O_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-18 isotope (H2 18O), including solid phase only.
prsn18O_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Precipitation Flux of Snow and Ice Containing Oxygen-18 (H2 18O)

prsn2h_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain one atom of the hydrogen-2 isotope (1H 2H O), including solid phase only.
prsn2h_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Precipitation Flux of Snow and Ice Containing Deuterium (1H 2H O)

prsn_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

prsn_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Rate of change of snow mass due to solid precipitation (i.e. snowfall) falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Always positive or zero.

prsn_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

prsn_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

prsnc_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean

prsnsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
prsnsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Fraction of Snowfall (Including Hail and Graupel) on Snow

prveg_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
prveg_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: the precipitation flux that is intercepted by the vegetation canopy (if present in model) before reaching the ground.

prw_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

prw_tpt-u-hxy-u.description: Vertically integrated mass of water vapour
prw_tpt-u-hxy-u.ui-label: 6 hourly instantaneous vertically integrated water vapor

prw_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

ps_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: not, in general, the same as mean sea-level pressure

ps_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: not, in general, the same as mean sea-level pressure

psl_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: not, in general, the same as surface pressure

pso_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
pso_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.  "Sea water pressure" is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.
pso_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Sea Water Pressure at Sea Water Surface

ptp_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

qgwr_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean

raLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
raLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Respiration from Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

raLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]. Calculated on land-use tiles.

raOther_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
raOther_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Respiration from Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

raRoot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
raRoot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Total autotrophic respiration from all belowground plant parts.  This has benchmarking value because the sum of Rh and root respiration can be compared to observations of total soil respiration.

raStem_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
raStem_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Total Respiration from Stem as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

raVgt_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]. Calculated on vegetation type.

ra_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
ra_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]
ra_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

ra_tavg-u-hxy-ng.description: Total RA of grass in the grid cell

ra_tavg-u-hxy-shb.description: Total RA of shrubs in the grid cell

rac13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Flux of carbon-13 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.

rac14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean

reffclic_tavg-al-hxy-ccl.description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

reffclic_tpt-al-hxys-ccl.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where convective_cloud time: point
reffclic_tpt-al-hxys-ccl.ui-label: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Cloud Ice

reffclis_tavg-al-hxy-scl.description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).
reffclis_tavg-al-hxy-scl.ui-label: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Cloud Ice

reffclis_tpt-al-hxy-scl.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where stratiform_cloud time: point

reffclis_tpt-al-hxys-scl.ui-label: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Cloud Ice

reffclwc_tavg-al-hxy-ccl.description: Droplets are liquid.  The effective radius is defined as the ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution and the time-mean should be calculated, weighting the individual samples by the cloudy fraction of the grid cell.
reffclwc_tavg-al-hxy-ccl.ui-label: Convective Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius

reffclwc_tpt-al-hxys-ccl.ui-label: Convective Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius

reffclws_tavg-al-hxy-scl.description: Droplets are liquid.  The effective radius is defined as the ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution and the time-mean should be calculated, weighting the individual samples by the cloudy fraction of the grid cell.
reffclws_tavg-al-hxy-scl.ui-label: Stratiform Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius

reffclws_tpt-al-hxy-scl.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where stratiform_cloud time: point
reffclws_tpt-al-hxy-scl.description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

reffclws_tpt-al-hxys-scl.ui-label: Stratiform Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius

reffclwtop_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere.TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

reffsclwtop_tavg-u-hxy-scl.description: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud
reffsclwtop_tavg-u-hxy-scl.ui-label: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud

rhc13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
rhc13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

rhc14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean

Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

rlds_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Ice Sheet Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation

rlds_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Downwelling longwave flux from the atmosphere to the sea-ice surface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
rlds_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Downwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice

rlds_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

rlds_tpt-u-hxy-u.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

rlds_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
