rsds_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Hourly downward solar radiation flux at the surface
rsds_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Hourly downward solar radiation flux at the surface

rsds_tavg-u-hxy-ufs.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ time: mean where unfrozen_soil (at the surface, but frozen below zero isotherm)
rsds_tavg-u-hxy-ufs.description: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell not covered by ice sheets or snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
rsds_tavg-u-hxy-ufs.ui-label: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Land Not Covered by Ice Sheets or Snow

rsds_tpt-u-hxy-u.description: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

rsds_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

rsdscs_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

rsdscs_tpt-u-hxy-u.description: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

rsdscs_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

rsdscsdiff_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations in clear sky conditions
rsdscsdiff_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Clear Sky Shortwave Radiation

rsdsdiff_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations.

rsdt_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere

rsdt_tclmdc-u-hxy-u.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean time: mean within days time: mean over days
rsdt_tclmdc-u-hxy-u.description: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere

rsdt_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: at the top of the atmosphere

rsntds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
rsntds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: The radiative flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.
rsntds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface

rss_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Net downward shortwave radiation at the surface

rsu4co2_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: Upwelling Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

rsu_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

rsu_tpt-alh-hxys-u.description: Upwelling shortwave radiation  (includes also the fluxes at the surface and top of atmosphere)

rsucs4co2_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: Upwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

rsucs_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

rsucs_tpt-alh-hxys-u.description: Upwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation  (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rsus_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ time: mean where ice_free_sea over sea
rsus_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.description: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of an ocean grid cell not covered by sea ice. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
rsus_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.ui-label: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Ocean Not Covered by Sea Ice

rsus_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
rsus_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation

rsus_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Upward shortwave flux from the sea-ice surface to the atmosphere (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
rsus_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Upwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice

rsus_tavg-u-hxy-sn.description: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell covered by snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
rsus_tavg-u-hxy-sn.ui-label: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Snow

rsus_tavg-u-hxy-ufs.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ time: mean where unfrozen_soil (at the surface, but frozen below zero isotherm)
rsus_tavg-u-hxy-ufs.description: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell not covered by ice sheets or snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
rsus_tavg-u-hxy-ufs.ui-label: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Land Not Covered by Ice Sheets or Snow

rsus_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

rsut4co2_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold
rsut4co2_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation in 4XCO2 Atmosphere

rsut_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: at the top of the atmosphere

rsut_tclmdc-u-hxy-u.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean time: mean within days time: mean over days
rsut_tclmdc-u-hxy-u.description: at the top of the atmosphere

rsut_tpt-u-hxy-u.description: at the top of the atmosphere

rsut_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: at the top of the atmosphere

rsutaf_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Flux corresponding to rsut resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation

rsutch4ref_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is the outgoing shortwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field
rsutch4ref_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: TOA outgoing shortwave flux assuming reference methane

rsutcs4co2_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold
rsutcs4co2_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere

rsutcs_tclmdc-u-hxy-u.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean time: mean within days time: mean over days
rsutcs_tclmdc-u-hxy-u.description: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

rsutcs_tpt-u-hxy-u.description: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

rsutcs_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

rsutcsaf_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Flux corresponding to rsutcs resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation
rsutcsaf_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation

rsutcsch4ref_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is the outgoing shortwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field
rsutcsch4ref_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: TOA outgoing shortwave flux assuming clear-sky and reference methane field

rsutcso3ref_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This represents the top-of-atmosphere outgoing shortwave radiative flux assuming clear-sky conditions when a reference ozone field is used in a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme
rsutcso3ref_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: TOA shortwave flux assuming clear sky and reference ozone

rsuto3ref_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is top-of-atmosphere outgoing shortwave flux for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme, using a reference ozone field
rsuto3ref_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: TOA shortwave flux assuming reference ozone field

rtmt_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.
rtmt_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model

rtmt_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.
rtmt_tpt-u-hxys-u.ui-label: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model

rv850_tavg-850hPa-hxy-air.description: Relative vorticity is the upward component of the vorticity vector i.e. the component which arises from horizontal velocity.

rv850_tpt-850hPa-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: point
rv850_tpt-850hPa-hxy-air.description: Relative vorticity is the upward component of the vorticity vector i.e. the component which arises from horizontal velocity.

rzwc_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean

sbl_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
sbl_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux

sbl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
sbl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass resulting from their conversion to water vapor.  Computed as the total sublimation on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing for snow-free land regions; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0.
sbl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux

sbl_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Rate of change of snow mass through sublimation divided by grid-cell area. If a model does not differentiate between the sublimation of snow and sea ice, we recommend to report all sublimation within sisndmasssubl as long as the ice is snow covered.
sbl_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Evaporation or Sublimation

sbl_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: surface upward flux of water vapor due to sublimation of surface snow and ice
sbl_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux

sbl_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.
sbl_tpt-u-hxys-u.ui-label: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux

sci_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell. This variable is binary, indicating whether at each time step convection occurs (1.0), or not (0.0).
sci_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs

sci_tavg-u-hxys-u.description: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell. This variable is binary, indicating whether at each time step convection occurs (1.0), or not (0.0).
sci_tavg-u-hxys-u.ui-label: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs

scint_tavg-op4-hxy-sea.description: This is a fundamental aspect of the changes in the hydrological cycle and their impact on the oceans, and due to new numerical schemes and vertical discretizations, it is important to calculate it consistently with the model formulation.
scint_tavg-op4-hxy-sea.ui-label: Integral wrt depth of seawater practical salinity expressed as salt mass content

scldncl_tavg-u-hxy-scl.description: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops
scldncl_tavg-u-hxy-scl.ui-label: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops

sduo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sduo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: The eastward component of the net drift velocity of ocean water caused by surface wind-sea waves. The Stokes drift velocity could be defined as the difference between the average Lagrangian flow velocity of a fluid parcel, and the average Eulerian flow velocity of the fluid at a fixed position.

sdvo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sdvo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: The northward component of the net drift velocity of ocean water caused by surface wind-sea waves. The Stokes drift velocity could be defined as the difference between the average Lagrangian flow velocity of a fluid parcel, and the average Eulerian flow velocity of the fluid at a fixed position.

sf6_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sf6_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". The chemical formula of sulfur hexafluoride is SF6.
sf6_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Mole Concentration of SF6 in Sea Water

sfacrossline_tavg-u-ht-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ sum where sea time: mean
sfacrossline_tavg-u-ht-sea.description: Depth-integrated total salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes across different lines on the Earth's surface (based on appendix J and table J1 of Griffies et al., 2016). Formally, this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the heat transport. Positive and negative numbers refer to total northward/eastward and southward/westward transports, respectively. The transport should be evaluated for the full depth of the ocean, except for the Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is averaged from the surface to 350m.
sfacrossline_tavg-u-ht-sea.ui-label: Ocean Salt Mass Transport across Lines

sfcWind_tavg-h10m-hxy-u.description: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind

sfcWind_tmax-h10m-hxy-u.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean time: maximum within days time: mean over days
sfcWind_tmax-h10m-hxy-u.description: Daily maximum near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.

sfcWind_tpt-h10m-hxys-u.description: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind

sfdsi_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sfdsi_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
sfdsi_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux

sfdsi_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Total flux of salt from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area. This flux is upward (negative) during ice growth when salt is embedded into the ice and downward (positive) during melt when salt from sea ice is again released to the ocean.

sfpm10_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mass fraction atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 10 micrometers

sfpm10_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Hourly PM10 Mass Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer

sfpm1_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Hourly PM1.0 Mass Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer

sfpm25_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Mass fraction of atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 2.5 micrometers. To specify the relative humidity and temperature at which the particle size applies, provide scalar coordinate variables with the standard names of "relative\_humidity" and "air\_temperature".
sfpm25_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.ui-label: PM2.5 Mass Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer

sfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content.  Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.
sfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers

sftflf_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by floating ice shelf, the component of the ice sheet that is flowing over sea water

sftflf_ti-u-hxy-u.description: This is needed to distinguish between grounded glaciated ice (grounded = ice sheet and glacier) and ice shelves (floating over sea water), since land\_ice is by definition ice sheet, glacier and ice shelves

sftgif_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is needed in case the ice sheet area changes in time

sftgif_ti-u-hxy-u.description: fraction of grid cell occupied by "permanent" ice (i.e., glaciers).

sftgrf_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by grounded ice sheet

sftgrf_ti-u-hxy-u.description: This is needed to distinguish between grounded glaciated ice (grounded = ice sheet and glacier) and ice shelves (floating over sea water), since land\_ice is by definition ice sheet, glacier and ice shelves

sftlaf_ti-u-hxy-u.description: Fraction of horizontal land grid cell area occupied by lake.
sftlaf_ti-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Fraction of the Grid Cell Occupied by Lake

sftlf_ti-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of horizontal area occupied by land.
sftlf_ti-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Percentage of the Grid Cell Occupied by Land (Including Lakes)

sftof_ti-u-hxy-u.description: This is the area fraction at the ocean surface.

sfx_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sfx_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.

sfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea depth: sum where sea (over entire ocean column) time: mean
sfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Ocean salt mass x transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.
sfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Vertically Integrated Ocean Salt Mass X Transport

sfy_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sfy_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.

sfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea depth: sum where sea (over entire ocean column) time: mean
sfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Ocean salt mass y transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.
sfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Vertically Integrated Ocean Salt Mass Y Transport

shrubFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.

si_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
si_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic silicon" means the sum of all inorganic silicon in solution (including silicic acid and its first dissociated anion SiO(OH)3-).
si_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Total Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Concentration

si_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
si_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic silicon" means the sum of all inorganic silicon in solution (including silicic acid and its first dissociated anion SiO(OH)3-).

siage_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Age of sea ice since its formation in open water.

sialgc_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) depth: sum where sea_ice time: mean
sialgc_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Vertically-integrated content of carbon in ice algae, expressed as moles of carbon per square meter of sea ice.
sialgc_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Total Ice Algal Carbon Amount in Sea Ice

siarea_tavg-u-hm-u.description: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

siareaacrossline_tavg-u-ht-u.description: Net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W,81.3N) to (10.5E,79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N).

sichl_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) depth: sum where sea_ice time: mean
sichl_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Vertically-integrated content of Chl-a in ice algae, expressed as kg of Chl-a per square meter of sea ice.
sichl_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Amount of Total Ice Algae Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Ice

sicompstren_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Computed strength of the ice pack, defined as the energy (J m-2) dissipated per unit area removed from the ice pack under compression, and assumed proportional to the change in potential energy caused by ridging. For Hibler-type models, this is P = P\* h exp(-C(1-A)) where P\* is compressive strength, h is ice thickness, A is compactness and C is strength reduction constant.

siconc_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the ocean grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.

siconca_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Areal fraction of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the atmosphere grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.

sidconcdyn_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sidconcdyn_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Total rate of change in sea-ice area fraction through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence, etc.).
sidconcdyn_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Sea-Ice Area Fraction Tendency Due to Dynamics

sidconcth_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sidconcth_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Total rate of change in sea-ice area fraction through thermodynamic processes.
sidconcth_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Sea-Ice Area Fraction Tendency Due to Thermodynamics

sidivvel_tpt-u-hxy-si.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) time: point
sidivvel_tpt-u-hxy-si.description: Divergence of sea-ice velocity field (first shear strain invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).
sidivvel_tpt-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Divergence of the Sea-Ice Velocity Field

sidmassdyn_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sidmassdyn_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Total rate of change in sea-ice mass through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence, etc.) divided by grid-cell area.

sidmassgrowthbot_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sidmassgrowthbot_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to vertical growth of existing sea ice at its base divided by grid-cell area. Note that this number is always positive or zero since sea-ice melt is collected in sidmassmeltbot. This is to account for differential growth and melt in models with a sub-grid scale ice thickness distribution.
sidmassgrowthbot_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Basal Growth

sidmassgrowthsi_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sidmassgrowthsi_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Always positive or zero.
sidmassgrowthsi_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion

sidmassgrowthwat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sidmassgrowthwat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to sea ice formation in supercooled water (often through frazil formation) divided by grid-cell area. Always positive or zero.
sidmassgrowthwat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Growth in Supercooled Open Water (Frazil)

sidmassmeltbot_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sidmassmeltbot_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through melting/dissolution at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area. Note that this number is always zero or negative since sea-ice growth is collected in sidmassgrowthbot. This is to account for differential growth and melt in models with a sub-grid scale ice thickness distribution.
sidmassmeltbot_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Bottom Melting

sidmassmeltlat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sidmassmeltlat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through lateral melting/dissolution divided by grid-cell area (report zero if not explicitly calculated thermodynamically). Always negative or zero.
sidmassmeltlat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Lateral Melting

sidmassmelttop_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sidmassmelttop_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through melting at the ice surface divided by grid-cell area. This number is independent of the actual fate of the meltwater, and will hence include all sea-ice meltwater that drains into the ocean and all sea-ice meltwater that is collected by a melt-pond parameterisation. Always negative or zero.
sidmassmelttop_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Surface Melting

sidmassth_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sidmassth_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Total rate of change in sea-ice mass from thermodynamic processes divided by grid-cell area.

sidmasstranx_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: X-component of the sea-ice drift-induced transport of snow and sea ice mass.

sidmasstrany_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Y-component of the sea-ice drift-induced transport of snow and sea ice mass.

sidragbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Oceanic drag coefficient that is used to calculate the oceanic momentum drag on sea ice.

sidragtop_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Atmospheric drag coefficient that is used to calculate the atmospheric momentum drag on sea ice.

sieqthick_tavg-u-hxy-u.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sieqthick_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area, also known as the equivalent thickness of sea ice.

siextent_tavg-u-hm-u.description: Total integrated area of all grid cells that are covered by at least 15% sea ice (siconc >= 15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

sifb_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Mean height of sea-ice surface (i.e. snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level. This follows the classical definition of freeboard for in situ observations. In the satellite community, sometimes the total height of sea ice and snow above sea level is referred to as freeboard. This can easily be calculated by adding sisnthick to sifb.

siflcondbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Net heat conduction flux at the ice base, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the lowermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the base of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
siflcondbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Base

siflcondtop_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Net heat conduction flux at the ice surface, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the uppermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the surface of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
siflcondtop_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Surface

siflfwbot_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
siflfwbot_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: computed as the sea ice thermodynamic water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
siflfwbot_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Water Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics

siflfwbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area. This flux is positive when fresh water enters the ocean, and is therefore negative during ice growth and positive during ice melt.

siflfwdrain_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Total flux of fresh water from sea-ice surface into underlying ocean divided by grid-cell area. This combines both surface meltwater that drains directly into the ocean and the drainage of surface melt ponds. By definition, this flux is always positive.

sifllattop_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Net latent heat flux over sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
sifllattop_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Net Latent Heat Flux over Sea Ice

siflsensbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Net sensible heat flux under sea ice from or to the ocean (energy flow per sea ice area). Per sign convention, heat from the ocean is counted as negative since it describes an upward heat flux.
siflsensbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux under Sea Ice

siflsenstop_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Net sensible heat flux over sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
siflsenstop_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Net Downward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice

siflswdbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Downwelling shortwave flux underneath sea ice, i.e. the amount of shortwave radiation that penetrates the sea ice and reaches the sea ice-ocean interface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
siflswdbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Downwelling Shortwave Flux under Sea Ice

siforcecoriolx_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by the Coriolis force divided by grid-cell area.
siforcecoriolx_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (X-Component)

siforcecorioly_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by the Coriolis force divided by grid-cell area.
siforcecorioly_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)

siforceintstrx_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma) divided by grid-cell area.
siforceintstrx_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Internal Stress Term in Force Balance (X-Component)

siforceintstry_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma) divided by grid-cell area.
siforceintstry_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Internal Stress Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)

siforcetiltx_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt divided by grid-cell area.
siforcetiltx_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Sea-Surface Tilt Term in Force Balance (X-Component)

siforcetilty_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt divided by grid-cell area.
siforcetilty_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Sea-Surface Tilt Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)

sigpp_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Change in ice algal carbon mass due to photosynthesis per sea ice unit area per unit time.
sigpp_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Gross Primary Productivity in Sea Ice as Carbon Amount Flux

sihc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sihc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Water at 0C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. This variable does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine in the sea ice. Heat content is always negative since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water.

siitdconc_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by each ice thickness category (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis).
siitdconc_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Sea-Ice Area Fractions in Ice Thickness Categories

siitdsnconc_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by snow in each ice thickness category (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis).
siitdsnconc_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Snow Area Fractions in Ice Thickness Categories

siitdsnthick_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Actual thickness of snow in each ice thickness category, NOT snow volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis). It can also be derived by dividing the volume of snow by the area of snow in each thickness category.
siitdsnthick_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Snow Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories

siitdthick_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice in each ice thickness category, NOT volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis).
siitdthick_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Sea-Ice Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories

simass_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
simass_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Total mass of sea ice divided by grid-cell area.

simassacrossline_tavg-u-ht-u.description: Net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice mass transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W,81.3N) to (10.5E,79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N).

simpconc_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by melt ponds.
simpconc_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Melt Pond

simpeffconc_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by open melt ponds, that is melt ponds that are not covered by snow or ice lids. This represents the effective (i.e. radiatively-active) melt pond area fraction.
simpeffconc_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Effective Melt Pond

simprefrozen_tavg-u-hxy-simp.description: Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by melt pond covered area.
simprefrozen_tavg-u-hxy-simp.ui-label: Thickness of Refrozen Ice on Melt Pond

simpthick_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Average depth of melt ponds on sea ice, that is melt pond volume divided by melt pond area.

simpthick_tavg-u-hxy-simp.description: Average depth of melt ponds on sea ice, that is melt pond volume divided by melt pond area.

sino3_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) depth: sum where sea_ice time: mean
sino3_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Vertically-integrated amount of nitrate in ice algae, expressed in moles of nitrogen per square meter of sea ice.
sino3_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Dissolved Nitrate Amount in Sea Ice

sirdgconc_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is ridged sea ice.

sisali_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the mean salinity used in the calculation of the salt budget should be reported.

sisaltmass_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sisaltmass_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the total mass of all salt in sea ice should be calculated from the salinity value used in the calculation of the salt budget.
sisaltmass_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Mass of Salt in Sea Ice

sishearvel_tpt-u-hxy-si.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) time: point
sishearvel_tpt-u-hxy-si.description: Maximum shear of sea-ice velocity field (second shear strain invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).
sishearvel_tpt-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Maximum Shear of Sea-Ice Velocity Field

sisi_tavg-u-hxy-si.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) depth: sum where sea_ice time: mean
sisi_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Vertically-integrated amount of silicate in ice algae, expressed in moles of silicon per square meter of sea ice.
sisi_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Dissolved Silicon Amount in Sea Ice

sisndmassdyn_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Rate of change of snow mass due to sea ice dynamics (advection, divergence, etc.) divided by grid-cell area.
sisndmassdyn_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Advection by Sea-Ice Dynamics

sisndmasssi_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Always negative or zero.
sisndmasssi_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion

sisndmasswind_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Rate of change of snow mass due to wind-driven transport into the ocean divided by grid-cell area.
sisndmasswind_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Wind Drift of Snow

sisnhc_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Heat content of all snow in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Snow-water equivalent at 0 C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include the heat content of sea ice.

sisnmass_tavg-u-hm-u.description: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere.
sisnmass_tavg-u-hm-u.ui-label: Snow Mass on Sea Ice North

sisnmassacrossline_tavg-u-ht-u.description: Net (sum of transport in all directions) snow mass transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W,81.3N) to (10.5E,79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N).

sispeed_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Speed of ice (i.e. mean absolute velocity) to account for back-and-forth movement of the ice.

sistressave_tpt-u-hxy-si.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) time: point
sistressave_tpt-u-hxy-si.description: Average normal stress in sea ice (first stress invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).
sistressave_tpt-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Average Normal Stress in Sea Ice

sistressmax_tpt-u-hxy-si.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) time: point
sistressmax_tpt-u-hxy-si.description: Maximum shear stress in sea ice (second stress invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).
sistressmax_tpt-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Maximum Shear Stress in Sea Ice

sistrxdtop_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: X-component of the atmospheric stress on the surface of sea ice divided by grid-cell area.
sistrxdtop_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: X-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice

sistrxubot_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: X-component of the ocean stress on the sea ice bottom divided by grid-cell area.
sistrxubot_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: X-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice

sistrydtop_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Y-component of the atmospheric stress on the surface of sea ice divided by grid-cell area.
sistrydtop_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Y-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice

sistryubot_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Y-component of the ocean stress on the sea ice bottom divided by grid-cell area.
sistryubot_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Y-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice

sitempbot_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Mean temperature at the base of the sea ice, NOT the temperature within lowermost sea-ice model layer.

sitempsnic_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Mean temperature at the snow-ice interface. This is the surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero.

sitemptop_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Mean surface temperature of the sea-ice covered part of the grid cell. Wherever snow covers the ice, the surface temperature of the snow is used for the averaging, otherwise the surface temperature of the ice is used.

sithick_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice averaged over the ice-covered part of a given grid cell, NOT volume divided by grid area.

sithick_tavg-u-hxy-sir.description: Total volume of ridged sea ice divided by area of ridges, i.e. mean thickness of ridged sea ice.

sitimefrac_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sitimefrac_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc > 0) in a grid cell.
sitimefrac_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice

siu_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: X-component of sea-ice velocity on native model grid.

siv_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Y-component of sea-ice velocity on native model grid.

sivol_tavg-u-hm-u.description: Total integrated volume of sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere.

sltbasin_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ longitude: sum where sea (along a zig-zag grid path spanning a basin)  time: mean
sltbasin_tavg-u-hys-sea.description: Northward Ocean Salt Transport from all physical processes affecting northward salt transport, resolved and parameterized. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.

sltovgyre_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ longitude: sum where sea (along a zig-zag grid path spanning a basin)  time: mean
sltovgyre_tavg-u-hys-sea.description: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
sltovgyre_tavg-u-hys-sea.ui-label: Northward Ocean Salt Transport Due to Gyre

sltovovrt_tavg-u-hys-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ longitude: sum where sea (along a zig-zag grid path spanning a basin)  time: mean
sltovovrt_tavg-u-hys-sea.description: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
sltovovrt_tavg-u-hys-sea.ui-label: Northward Ocean Salt Transport Due to Overturning

smc_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: The net mass flux represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  For models with a distinct shallow convection scheme, this is calculated as convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

snc_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

snc_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Fraction of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

snc_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Percentage of the sea-ice surface that is covered by snow. In many models that do not explicitly resolve a percentage of snow, this variable will always be either 0 or 100.

snd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
snd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: where land over land, this is computed as the mean thickness of snow in the land portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire land portion, including the snow-free fraction).  Reported as missing where the land fraction is 0.

snd_tavg-u-hxy-sn.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ time: mean where snow (for snow on sea ice only)
snd_tavg-u-hxy-sn.description: Actual thickness of snow averaged over the snow-covered part of the sea ice. This thickness is usually directly available within the model formulation. It can also be derived by dividing the total volume of snow by the area of the snow.

snicem_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: Loss of snow and ice mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the total surface melt on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.
snicem_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Surface Snow and Ice Melt Flux

snm_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: Loss of snow mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the surface melt water from snow on the ice sheet portion of the grid cell divided by the ice\_sheet area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 for snow-free land\_ice regions; report as missing where the land fraction is 0.

snm_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
snm_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Computed as the total surface melt water on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 for snow-free land regions; report as missing where the land fraction is 0.

snm_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Rate of change of snow mass through melt divided by grid-cell area. Always negative or zero.
snm_tavg-u-hxy-si.ui-label: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Melt

snmsl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean

snrefr_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
snrefr_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux

snrefr_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
snrefr_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Refreezing of Water in the Snow

snw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
snw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Computed as the mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excluded is snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.

snw_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Total mass of snow on sea ice divided by grid-cell area. This then allows one to analyse the storage of latent heat in the snow, and to calculate the snow-water equivalent.

snwc_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
snwc_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Snow Water Equivalent Intercepted by the Vegetation

so2_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

so2_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface so2 volume mixing ration at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
so2_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.ui-label: Surface SO2 volume mixing ratio at CF sites

so_tavg-ol-hm-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
so_tavg-ol-hm-sea.description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

so_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
so_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

sob_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sob_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Model prognostic salinity at bottom-most model grid cell
sob_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Sea Water Salinity at Sea Floor

somint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
somint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Full column sum of density\*cell thickness\*salinity. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.
somint_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Prognostic Salinity

sootsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
sootsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: the entire land portion of the grid cell is considered, with snow soot content set to 0.0 in regions free of snow.

sos_tavg-u-hm-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sos_tavg-u-hm-sea.description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

sos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

sossq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sossq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

spco2_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
spco2_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2.
spco2_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2

stratch4loss_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This is the loss rate of stratospheric methane by all chemical destruction. The distinction between the stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause as used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp). It should have zero values in the troposphere.
stratch4loss_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Loss of Stratospheric Methane by all chemical destruction

strbasemag_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: Magnitude of basal drag at land ice base

sw17O_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sw17O_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Ratio of abundance of oxygen-17 (17O) atoms to oxygen-16 (16O) atoms in sea water
sw17O_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Isotopic Ratio of Oxygen-17 in Sea Water

sw18O_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sw18O_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Ratio of abundance of oxygen-18 (18O) atoms to oxygen-16 (16O) atoms in sea water
sw18O_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Isotopic Ratio of Oxygen-18 in Sea Water

sw2H_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
sw2H_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Ratio of abundance of hydrogen-2 (2H) atoms to hydrogen-1 (1H) atoms in sea water
sw2H_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Isotopic Ratio of Deuterium in Sea Water

sw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
sw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Total liquid water storage, other than soil, snow or interception storage (i.e. lakes, river channel or depression storage).

sweLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "lwe" means liquid water equivalent. "Amount" means mass per unit area. The construction lwe\_thickness\_of\_X\_amount or \_content means the vertical extent of a layer of liquid water having the same mass per unit area. Surface amount refers to the amount on the ground, excluding that on the plant or vegetation canopy.
sweLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Snow Water Equivalent on Land-Use Tile

swh_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
swh_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

swh_tmax-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: maximum
swh_tmax-u-hxy-sea.description: Highest value of the significant wave height simulated within a given time range (e.g., daily or monthly). The significant wave height (swh) is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, swh is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

swhswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
swhswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This parameter is derived from all swell partitions of the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the components of the two-dimensional wave spectrum that are not under the influence of local wind.

swhwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
swhwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). It is derived from the wind-sea wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wind-sea wave spectrum.

t17d_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean

t20d_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean

tas_tmin-h2m-hxy-u.description: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell\_method attribute "time: min")

tnhusa_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Advection
tnhusa_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Advection

tnhusa_tpt-al-hxys-u.description: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Advection
tnhusa_tpt-al-hxys-u.ui-label: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Advection

tnhusc_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Convection

tnhusc_tpt-al-hxys-u.ui-label: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Convection

tnhusd_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.
tnhusd_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Numerical Diffusion

tnhusd_tpt-al-hxys-u.description: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.
tnhusd_tpt-al-hxys-u.ui-label: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Numerical Diffusion

tnhusmp_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physicsl.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.
tnhusmp_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Model Physics

tnhusmp_tpt-al-hxys-u.description: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized moist physics (e.g. convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics or from horizontal or vertical numerical diffusion not associated with model physicsl.  For example any diffusive mixing by the boundary layer scheme would be included.
tnhusmp_tpt-al-hxys-u.ui-label: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Model Physics

tnhuspbl_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive terms.
tnhuspbl_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Boundary Layer Mixing

tnhuspbl_tpt-al-hxys-u.ui-label: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Boundary Layer Mixing

tnhusscp_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: The phrase "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. "Specific" means per unit mass. Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due\_to\_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name of tendency\_of\_specific\_humidity\_due\_to\_stratiform\_cloud\_and\_precipitation should contain the effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation to or from water vapor. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).
tnhusscp_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation

tnhusscp_tpt-al-hxys-u.ui-label: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation

tnhusscpbl_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: To be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all bounday layer terms including and diffusive terms.
tnhusscpbl_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing

tnhusscpbl_tpt-al-hxys-u.description: To be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all bounday layer terms including and diffusive terms.
tnhusscpbl_tpt-al-hxys-u.ui-label: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing

tnkebto_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
tnkebto_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from parameterized eddy-induced advection. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.
tnkebto_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Tendency of Ocean Eddy Kinetic Energy Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection

tnpeo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
tnpeo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Rate that work is done against vertical stratification, as measured by the vertical heat and salt diffusivity. Report here as depth integrated two-dimensional field.
tnpeo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Tendency of Ocean Potential Energy Content

tnta_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Advection

tntc_tpt-al-hxys-u.ui-label: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Convection

tntd_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical temperature diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the temperature budget.
tntd_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Numerical Diffusion

tntd_tpt-al-hxys-u.ui-label: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Numerical Diffusion

tntmp_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.
tntmp_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics

tntmp_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to model physics, with the extended number of vertical levels
tntmp_tavg-p39-hy-air.ui-label: Zonal mean tendency of air temperature due to model physics

tntmp_tpt-al-hxys-u.description: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.
tntmp_tpt-al-hxys-u.ui-label: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics

tntscp_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: The phrase "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due\_to\_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name tendency\_of\_air\_temperature\_due\_to\_stratiform\_cloud\_and\_precipitation should contain net latent heating effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation between water vapour, liquid or ice phases.
