tran_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
tran_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).

treeFracBdlDcd_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by broadleaf deciduous trees.

treeFracBdlEvg_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by broadleaf evergreen trees.

treeFracNdlDcd_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by needleleaf deciduous trees.

treeFracNdlEvg_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by needleleaf evergreen trees.

treeFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.

tropch4loss_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane by all chemical destruction. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp).  It should have zero values in the stratosphere.
tropch4loss_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Loss of Tropospheric Methane by all chemical destruction

tropch4lossoh_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane due to reaction with the hydroxy (OH) radical. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp).  It should have zero values in the stratosphere.
tropch4lossoh_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Tropospheric loss of methane by OH

tropdo3chm_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This is the net chemical tendency of ozone in the troposphere. The distinction between the stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the definition of the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere.
tropdo3chm_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Net Chemistry Tendency of O3 in troposphere

tropo3ste_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone in the troposphere. It represents the ozone volume mixing ratio in the troposphere that is considered to be stratospheric in origin. It should be consistent with the definition of tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere and non-zero positive values in the troposphere.
tropo3ste_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Tropospheric ozone volume mixing ratio due to stratosphere-troposphere exchange (STE)

tropoz_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Tropospheric ozone column, should be consistent with definition of tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp).

tsLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: Surface temperature (i.e. temperature at which long-wave radiation emitted)

ts_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

ts_tavg-u-hxy-sn.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean (weighted by snow area)

tsl_tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
tsl_tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.description: Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea".

tslsi_tavg-u-hxy-u.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ time: mean (over land and sea ice)
tslsi_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Surface temperature of all surfaces except open ocean.
tslsi_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice

tslsi_tpt-u-hxy-u.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean (over land and sea ice) time: point
tslsi_tpt-u-hxy-u.description: Surface temperature of all surfaces except open ocean, sampled synoptically.
tslsi_tpt-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice

tsn_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

tsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean (weighted by snow mass on land)
tsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice.  When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as "missing in regions free of snow on land.

ttop_tavg-u-hxy-cl.description: cloud\_top refers to the top of the highest cloud. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature.

ua_tavg-10hPa-hxy-air.description: Zonal wind on the 10 hPa surface

ua_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

ua_tavg-h100m-hxy-u.description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction) at 100m

ua_tavg-p19-hxy-air.description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

ua_tpt-200hPa-hxy-u.description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction) at 200 hPa, 6hourly instantaneous

ua_tpt-al-hxy-u.description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

ua_tpt-al-hxys-u.description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

ua_tpt-h100m-hxy-u.description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction) at 100m above the surface

ua_tpt-p3-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: point
ua_tpt-p3-hxy-air.description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

ua_tpt-p5u-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: point
ua_tpt-p5u-hxy-air.description: 6 hourly instantaneous eastward wind at 5 pressure levels in the UTLS region (150, 175, 200, 225, and 250 hPa)
ua_tpt-p5u-hxy-air.ui-label: 6 hourly instantaneous eastward wind in the UTLS region

ua_tpt-p6-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: point
ua_tpt-p6-hxy-air.description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction) on 6 pressure levels in the lower troposphere

ua_tpt-p7h-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: point
ua_tpt-p7h-hxy-air.description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

uas_tavg-h10m-hxy-u.description: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind

uas_tpt-h10m-hxy-u.description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction) at 10 meters above the surface.

uas_tpt-h10m-hxys-u.description: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind

umo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
umo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: X-ward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

unknown01.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
unknown01.description: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

unknown02.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
unknown02.description: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

unknown03.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
unknown03.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

unknown04.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
unknown04.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

unknown05.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
unknown05.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.

uo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
uo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

uos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
uos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Daily surface prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
uos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Daily Surface Sea Water X Velocity

utendepfd_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Tendency of the zonal mean zonal wind due to the divergence of the Eliassen-Palm flux.
utendepfd_tavg-p39-hy-air.ui-label: Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to Eliassen-Palm Flux Divergence

utendnogw_tavg-p19-hxy-air.description: Tendency of eastward wind induced by the parameterized non-orographic gravity wave drag
utendnogw_tavg-p19-hxy-air.ui-label: Eastward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag

utendnogw_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Zonal mean tendency of eastward wind induced by the parameterized non-orographic gravity wave drag
utendnogw_tavg-p39-hy-air.ui-label: Eastward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag

utendogw_tavg-p19-hxy-air.description: Tendency of eastward wind induced by the parameterized orographic gravity wave drag
utendogw_tavg-p19-hxy-air.ui-label: Eastward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag

utendogw_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Zonal mean tendency of eastward wind induced by the parameterized orographic gravity wave drag
utendogw_tavg-p39-hy-air.ui-label: Eastward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag

utendvtem_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Zonal mean tendency of eastward wind due to TEM northward advection and Coriolis term
utendvtem_tavg-p39-hy-air.ui-label: Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to TEM Northward Advection and Coriolis Term

utendwtem_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Zonal mean tendency of eastward wind due to TEM upward advection
utendwtem_tavg-p39-hy-air.ui-label: Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to TEM Upward Advection

va_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

va_tavg-h100m-hxy-u.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction) at 100m

va_tavg-p19-hxy-air.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

va_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

va_tpt-200hPa-hxy-u.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction) at 200 hPa, 6 hourly instantaneous

va_tpt-al-hxy-u.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

va_tpt-al-hxys-u.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

va_tpt-h100m-hxy-u.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction) at 100m above the surface.

va_tpt-p3-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: point
va_tpt-p3-hxy-air.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

va_tpt-p5u-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: point
va_tpt-p5u-hxy-air.description: 6 hourly instantaneous northward wind at 5 pressure levels in the UTLS region (150, 175, 200, 225, and 250 hPa)
va_tpt-p5u-hxy-air.ui-label: 6 hourly instantaneous northward wind in the UTLS region

va_tpt-p6-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: point
va_tpt-p6-hxy-air.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction) on 6 pressure levels in the lower troposphere

va_tpt-p7h-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: point
va_tpt-p7h-hxy-air.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

vas_tpt-h10m-hxy-u.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction) at 10 meters above the surface.

vas_tpt-h10m-hxys-u.description: Northward component of the near surface wind

vegFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of grid cell that is covered by vegetation.This SHOULD be the sum of tree, grass (natural and pasture), crop and shrub fractions.

vegHeight_tavg-u-hxy-ng.description: Vegetation height averaged over the grass fraction of a grid cell.

vegHeight_tavg-u-hxy-shb.description: Vegetation height averaged over the shrub fraction of a grid cell.

vegHeight_tavg-u-hxy-tree.description: Vegetation height averaged over the tree fraction of a grid cell.

vegHeight_tavg-u-hxy-veg.description: Vegetation height averaged over all vegetation types and over the vegetated fraction of a grid cell.

vmo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
vmo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Y-ward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

vo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
vo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

volcello_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ sum where sea time: mean
volcello_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields

volcello_ti-ol-hxy-sea.description: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields

volo_tavg-u-hm-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ area: sum where sea time: mean
volo_tavg-u-hm-sea.description: Total volume of liquid sea water.

vos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
vos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Daily surface prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.
vos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Daily Surface Sea Water Y Velocity

vsf_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
vsf_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.
vsf_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water

vsfcorr_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
vsfcorr_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

vsfevap_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
vsfevap_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: zero for models using real water fluxes.
vsfevap_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Evaporation

vsfpr_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
vsfpr_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: zero for models using real water fluxes.
vsfpr_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Rainfall

vsfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
vsfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: zero for models using real water fluxes.
vsfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers

vsfsit_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
vsfsit_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: This variable measures the virtual salt flux into sea water due to the melting of sea ice. It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.
vsfsit_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics

vt100_tavg-100hPa-hy-air.description: Zonally averaged eddy temperature flux at 100hPa as monthly means derived from daily (or higher frequency) fields.

vtendnogw_tavg-p19-hxy-air.description: Tendency of northward wind induced by the parameterized non-orographic gravity wave drag
vtendnogw_tavg-p19-hxy-air.ui-label: Northward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag

vtendogw_tavg-p19-hxy-air.description: Tendency of northward wind induced by the parameterized orographic gravity wave drag
vtendogw_tavg-p19-hxy-air.ui-label: Northward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag

wa_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). Upward air velocity is the vertical component of the 3D air velocity vector. The standard name downward\_air\_velocity may be used for a vector component with the opposite sign convention.

wap_tavg-500hPa-hxy-air.description: at 500 hPa level; commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

wap_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

wap_tavg-p19-hxy-air.description: commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

wap_tavg-p19-hxy-u.description: commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

wap_tpt-al-hxys-u.description: commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)

wap_tpt-p6-hxy-air.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where air time: point
wap_tpt-p6-hxy-air.description: Omega (=dp/dt) on 6 pressure levels in the lower troposphere

wbgt_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description:
mean 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature (WBGT). 
Wet Bulb Globe Temperature (WBGT) is a particularly effective indicator of heat stress for active populations such as outdoor workers and athletes.
The calculation should be done with: 
WBGT = 0.567 \* T\_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, where T\_C is temperature in degrees C, and e = huss \* p \* M\_air / M\_H2O, where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", M\_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, M\_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air and "P = surface pressure in Pa"
wbgt_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.ui-label: mean 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature

wbgt_tmax-h2m-hxy-u.description:
max 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature (WGBT): 
Wet Bulb Globe Temperature (WBGT) is a particularly effective indicator of heat stress for active populations such as outdoor workers and athletes.
The calculation should be done with: 
WBGT = 0.567 \* T\_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, where T\_C is temperature in degrees C, and e = huss \* p \* M\_air / M\_H2O, where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", M\_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, M\_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air and "P = surface pressure in Pa"
wbgt_tmax-h2m-hxy-u.ui-label: maximum 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature

wdir_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
wdir_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

wdirswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
wdirswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

wdirwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
wdirwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

wetbc_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Surface deposition rate of black carbon (dry mass) due to wet processes
wetbc_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Wet Deposition Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass

wetdust_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Surface deposition rate of dust (dry mass) due to wet processes

wethno3_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This is the loss rate of nitric acid (HNO3) from the atmosphere due to wet deposition

wetlandCH4_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
wetlandCH4_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Net upward flux of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).
wetlandCH4_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Grid Averaged Methane Emissions from Wetlands

wetlandCH4cons_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
wetlandCH4cons_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Biological consumption (methanotrophy) of methane (NH4) by wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).
wetlandCH4cons_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Grid Averaged Methane Consumption (Methanotrophy) from Wetlands

wetlandCH4prod_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean
wetlandCH4prod_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Biological emissions (methanogenesis) of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).
wetlandCH4prod_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Grid Averaged Methane Production (Methanogenesis) from Wetlands

wetlandFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by wetland. Report only one year if  fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.

wetnh3_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Surface deposition rate of ammonia (NH3) due to wet processes

wetnh4_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Surface deposition rate of ammonium (NH4) due to wet processes

wetno3_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This is the loss rate of nitrate aerosol from the atmosphere due to wet deposition

wetnoy_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: NOy is the sum of all simulated oxidized nitrogen species, out of NO, NO2, HNO3, HNO4, NO3aerosol, NO3(radical), N2O5, PAN, other organic nitrates.
wetnoy_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Wet Deposition Rate of NOy Including Aerosol Nitrate

wetoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Deposition rate of organic matter in aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes
wetoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Wet Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Total Organic Matter

wetso2_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Deposition rate of sulfur dioxide due to wet processes

wetss_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Deposition rate of sea salt aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes
wetss_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Wet Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol

wfcorr_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
wfcorr_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to flux correction divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

wfo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
wfo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.

wmo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ sum where sea time: mean
wmo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Upward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

wo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
wo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

wpdir_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
wpdir_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

wpdirswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
wpdirswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

wpdirwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
wpdirwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

wpp_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
wpp_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.

wppswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
wppswell_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just swell waves.

wppwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
wppwindsea_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just wind-sea waves.

wsg_tmax-h100m-hxy-u.description: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 100m, monthly
wsg_tmax-h100m-hxy-u.ui-label: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 100m

wsg_tmax-h10m-hxy-u.description: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 10m, monthly
wsg_tmax-h10m-hxy-u.ui-label: Maximum Wind Speed of Gust at 10m

wtd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where land time: mean

wtem_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics w\*, upward component of the residual meridional circulation (v\*, w\*) derived from 6 hr or higher frequency data fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available). Scale height: 6950 m

xvelbase_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "x" indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. "basal" means the lower boundary of the land ice.
xvelbase_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: X-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity

xvelmean_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: The vertical mean land ice velocity is the average from the bedrock to the surface of the ice
xvelmean_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: X-Component of Land Ice Vertical Mean Velocity

xvelsurf_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "x" indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.
xvelsurf_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: X-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity

yvelbase_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "y" indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. "basal" means the lower boundary of the land ice.
yvelbase_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Y-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity

yvelmean_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: The vertical mean land ice velocity is the average from the bedrock to the surface of the ice
yvelmean_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Y-Component of Land Ice Vertical Mean Velocity

yvelsurf_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "y" indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.'
yvelsurf_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Y-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity

zfull_ti-al-hxy-u.description: Provide only if altitude of full model levels is fixed

zfullo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
zfullo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Depth Below Geoid of Ocean Layer

zg_tavg-1000hPa-hxy-air.description: Geopotential height on the 1000 hPa surface

zg_tavg-10hPa-hxy-air.description: Geopotential height on the 10 hPa surface

zg_tavg-500hPa-hxy-air.description: geopotential height on the 500 hPa surface

zg_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

zg_tavg-p19-hxy-air.description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

zg_tpt-700hPa-hxy-u.description: 700 hPa geopotential height at 6 hourly instantaneous frequency

zg_tpt-925hPa-hxy-u.description: Geopotential Height at 925 hPa, 6 hourly instantaneous

zmeso_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
zmeso_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: carbon concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone

zmeso_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean

zmeso_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

zmicro_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
zmicro_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone
zmicro_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

zmicro_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
zmicro_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone
zmicro_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

zmisc_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
zmisc_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: carbon from additional zooplankton component concentrations alone (e.g. Micro, meso).  Since the models all have different numbers of components, this variable has been included to provide a check for intercomparison between models since some phytoplankton groups are supersets.
zmisc_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Mole Concentration of Other Zooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

zmisc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
zmisc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: carbon from additional zooplankton component concentrations alone (e.g. Micro, meso).  Since the models all have different numbers of components, this variable has been included to provide a check for intercomparison between models since some phytoplankton groups are supersets.
zmisc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Mole Concentration of Other Zooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

zooc_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
zooc_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

zooc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
zooc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

zos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
zos_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice.

zossq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
zossq_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Square of Sea Surface Height Above Geoid

zostoga_tavg-u-hm-sea.cell-methods: vr:cell-method/ mean where sea time: mean
zostoga_tavg-u-hm-sea.description: There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.
zostoga_tavg-u-hm-sea.ui-label: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change

ztp_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

zvelbase_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). "basal" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere
zvelbase_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Upward Component of Land-Ice Basal Velocity

zvelsurf_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere
zvelsurf_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Upward Component of Land-Ice Surface Velocity
